channel.title: Compiling issue
channel.description:
Is there any way you can help me at all? I have been compiling both my server and my client compilers and it keeps saying "system cannot find path specified". I have the latest version of Jdk, I think its 7u17 and the code in my client and source compilers are JDK 1.7.0_05, i was wondering if you could take a look via team viewer or maybe you might know the codes or what the problem is?
The code in my compiler is @echo off Title Compiler cd Gian "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
If I am wrong, please point me in the right direction.. MY jdk version is 1.7.0 but i have no idea what code it is

item.title: Compiling issue
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:9, topic:516150”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=634409.msg4283161#msg4283161 date=1365987572]

How can a 32 bit compiler only be for a 64 bit machine?

You can run a 32 bit application on both 16, 32, and 64 bit machines, but you cannot run a 64 bit application on anything lower then a 64 bit machine.

I stated in a way they’d understand.

They have the x86 folder specifically to run only 32 bit applications. That’s it’s life. Don’t believe me? Go download and install the 32 bit version of any java.
Or go look at google chrome. Both are located in x86.
32+64 = 86. That’s why it’s x86

Yes, the two ‘Program File’ folders that are listed are for 32 bit and 64 bit version of Windows 7. The folder with (x86) is for 32 bit version.

Source: Click me!
[/quote]

The way you phrased it makes it sound like 32 bit applications can only run on a 64 bit machine.[/quote]
My bad

Read full topic

Or go look at google chrome. Both are located in x86.

The way you phrased it makes it sound like 32 bit applications can only run on a 64 bit machine.

item.title: Compiling issue
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:7, topic:516150”]How can a 32 bit compiler only be for a 64 bit machine?

You can run a 32 bit application on both 16, 32, and 64 bit machines, but you cannot run a 64 bit application on anything lower then a 64 bit machine.[/quote]
I stated in a way they’d understand.

They have the x86 folder specifically to run only 32 bit applications. That’s it’s life. Don’t believe me? Go download and install the 32 bit version of any java.
Or go look at google chrome. Both are located in x86.
32+64 = 86. That’s why it’s x86

Microsoft Support Engineer:

Yes, the two ‘Program File’ folders that are listed are for 32 bit and 64 bit version of Windows 7. The folder with (x86) is for 32 bit version.

Source: Click me!

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling issue
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

How can a 32 bit compiler only be for a 64 bit machine?

You can run a 32 bit application on both 16, 32, and 64 bit machines, but you cannot run a 64 bit application on anything lower then a 64 bit machine.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling issue
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You’re doing something wrong. You probably downloaded the 32 bit version and not the 64.
32 bit compiler:

@echo off
Title Compiler
cd ./Gian/
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_17\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

64 bit compiler

@echo off
Title Compiler
cd ./Gian/
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_17\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

NOTE: The 32 bit compiler above is only for 64 bit machines.

Edit:
@Reaper
While you are correct, if he doesn’t have that folder it’d say a different error.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling issue
item.dc:creator: @ReaperXScape ReaperXScape
item.description:
@ReaperXScape wrote:

ok well since im nice im gonna help you…

you see where it sais “cd Gian”, that means the compiler is looking somewhere else, and its not even written right, if you have a file called “Gian” change it to this : cd ./Gian/
if you dont have that file, remove that line.

@echo off
Title Compiler
cd Gian
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_17\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling issue
item.dc:creator: @i_want_fire i want fire
item.description:
@i_want_fire wrote:

Everyone that has looked at your post has turned around because of how sad the question is. I am even wondering why I am helping you…

@echo off
Title Compiler
cd Gian
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

This is how you fix it…

@echo off
Title Compiler
cd Gian
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

To fix this put whatever your jdk is so if it is jdk7u17 then where it says jdk1.7.0_5\bin

Make it jdk1.7.0_17\bin so it looks like this

@echo off
Title Compiler
cd Gian
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_17\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

I hope this helped!

Read full topic
